events.message: The customer reported an auto collision that occurred on the morning of March 30th, involving their sedan and another vehicle at a city intersection.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under the Auto Accident cluster due to the involvement of the insured vehicle in a traffic collision.
An experienced claims agent was assigned promptly to handle the customer's auto accident claim and initiate the resolution process.
The claim was officially acknowledged by the insurance company, and the customer was informed that their case is being processed.
The claims agent requested the customer submit the police report, photos of vehicle damage, and a copy of the driving license for evaluation.
Customer submitted all requested documents including the police accident report and images depicting the extent of damage to the vehicle.
The investigation team began reviewing submitted documents and contacted witnesses to assess fault and damage details in the auto accident.
The investigation concluded with findings confirming the insured was not at fault, and damage assessment reports were finalized.
A fair settlement offer was proposed based on the vehicle repair estimates and policy coverage limits to resolve the claim amicably.
The insured customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and appreciated the timely handling of their auto accident claim.
Following customer acceptance, the claim was approved by the insurance manager and prepared for payment processing.
Payment was issued promptly to the customerâ€™s bank account, covering all approved repair costs related to the vehicle collision.
The claim was officially closed with all documentation completed and the customer notified of the successful resolution of their auto accident claim.
